title: error importing CSV file if password contains semicolon (delimeter)
author: mahsoud
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior
If a value in CSV file contains a semicolon, it should be wrapped in double quotes or have alternative way to escape the delimeter.

## Current Behavior
The unescaped delimeter shifts/breaks values when imported.

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
Import CSV file like:

```CSV
Name;Id;Parent;NodeType;Description;Icon;Panel;Username;Password;Hostname;Protocol;PuttySession;Port;ConnectToConsole;UseCredSsp;RenderingEngine;ICAEncryptionStrength;RDPAuthenticationLevel;Lo...

comments.snippet:
+1
I also tried to workaround this by wrapping the password in quotes in the CSV and it just put parts of the password allover in other fields upon import.
comments.author: briantist

comments.snippet:
Dev note:
Forbidden Characters are not properly escpaed when exporting to CSV.
See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180

_2.6 and 2.7:_
>   6.  Fields containing line breaks (CRLF), double quotes, and commas
       should be enclosed in double-quotes.  For example:
       "aaa","b CRLF
       bb","ccc" CRLF
       zzz,yyy,xxx
>   7.  If double-quotes are used to enclose fields, then a double-quote
       appearing inside a field must be escaped by preceding it with
       another doub...
comments.author: farosch

comments.snippet:
Looking at the code, the character is just droped.. making export useless imho
